title: can we remove yasuo
body:
yasuo is a well known cancer champion and no amount of nerfs is going to stop the cancer as his strength not only lays with his passive and mobility but also the item prices in the shop. 2600 for a phatom dancer is a reasonable price, for adc's but for yasuo? thats 60% crit before someone can even finish a zhonyas, yomuus or most first items. with the 45% attack speed 60% crit and auto resets on 1 second cd even at low levels that is an insane amount of dps, not to mention in a melee matchup where yasuo just q constantly to zone from minions. how is any of this fair riot? there are an insane amount of haters for yasuo with good reason...
not to mention all yasuo mains are toxic and think they are the best in the world!

replies.body:
Yasuo. Will forever. Stay a champion.
So.
Please.
Get over it.
And.
Rest. In. Peace.
Cant beat him? Join him lol. Thats something i learnt

Taking that logic tho:

Our bodies need to poo, and no matter how much of an inconvenience it may be, theres no way to stop it.

**Option 1:** If you cant beat it join it, and just shit everywhere whenever you want, leaving crap trails behind you.

**Option 2:** Try to reduce the problem as much as you can, and go to a special box where the smell cant get out, and drop it in a little ceramic bowl and flush it away with water so it cant bother anyone.

So rather than let Yasuo leave crap trails all through league, why don't we put him in a box and flush that shit away.

Why remove Yasuo when you got Malzahar with his aids and dont get me started on Ekko

I understand that you're still level 9 and there is a champion that is very annoying but you haven't seen anything yet. Buckle up kid.

I honestly cant tell.
lmao Yasuo mains are so crap at other champions cus they spam abilities and then lose all their mana and go "what the frick why cant i q Ashe" or something.
yasuo dosent use mana...

exactly
i mean if they were playing as another champion

say yas gets a pd. he's going to have 80 ad with a 60% chance of doing a bit under 160 dmg. and his q is balanced since it's already hard enough to get 3 stacks off in a teamfight before he gets melted. and you can dodge his q. it's like complaining about darius being op after letting him get 5 stacks on you.

If you let him cs and get items, if you let him just hit you bc you're too busy complaining about how op he is, obviously you're going to get smashed in the face and you probably didn't consider the fact that haters would promote toxidity (so keep it down to whiteboard marker toxic level)

have a nice night...or day

> [{quoted}](name=TheOneUser,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=5vKUkgGX,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-09-16T12:45:03.874+0000)
>

> If you let him cs and get items,

Thats rich when a single Q, 1 hits half a wave...

You say that about Darius as if you can stop him getting stacks on you.
So tell me, how are you supposed to stop Darius getting 5 stacks on you? He pulls you in, Lands Q and then slows you with W. Thats already 2 or 3 stacks, all he has to do is get 2 more autos off on you... 

Now correct me if I'm mistaken, but thats not hard for a tank with Phage to do on a target thats slowed by 90%.

To be honest, if you grab someone as darius and hit Q and W, and they don't have flash, I physically don't understand how you can **NOT** get 5 stacks on them. You'd have to be a complete imbecile not to be able to.

Im going to go out on a limb here and say that you play Yasuo, and as such you're usually on the giving end of his bs, not the receiving end. So its only natural that you don't see where everyone else is coming from.
Using a certainlyT champ to compare against a certainlyT champ ;'                                        )

no i don't play yasuo, i play aram and when i do go up against a yasuo, he's getting smashed (though in a 1v1/2/3 without hard/chain cc, they can do well depending on how well they abuse his mobility) and on the flipside, it's only natural that you only see the bs from you yourself not knowing how to play against him. my point is, if he gets items, he will destroy you, if you let the game go on for too long, he will catch up, get full build, play whack-a-mole with your team. If you zone him from the wave lvl 1-6 without long engages and dying from the morbid anger propelling you to go kill him, then he's going to have to afk farm for another 10 min in which you can 4 man gankrape him (which is one thing that makes him strong since random 5 mans won't have the team coordination to do that despite playing a team game). 

*if you're going in with him already having items, they yes, there is nothing you can do, you've already lost* unless you hard cc him. 

the 5 stacks is what makes darius op. you know he'll get 5 stacks on you, yet you still walk into his pull range and let him do that and kill you.

like you don't 1v1 a lategame fiora, engage on a jax before he's used his stun, let a nasus just farm.

No one lets a darius pull them...
But at some point in your life, you have to go near the minions in your lane, and so does he, and when you are both there, you are within his pull range. You can try ducking in and out getting minions, but if you want farm, you will be putting yourself in a place that holds potential risk (every lane is like that). Remember that its not just you playing, you will do everything to avoid being pulled, and he will do everything he can to pull you, and sometimes he gets you and sometimes you get away, the only way to never get pulled is to not go near the minions, and if you do that, you lose all your gold.

And you can 1v1 a late game Fiora as Yasuo or Xin (seen it many tines).

Darius is a lane bully champ, if he's not fed early, he's going to get outscaled. what's wrong with letting him push and farming under tower? (even korean challengers choose to turret hug until the wave pushes to their tower in a risky lane)
He can pull you, but he's not going to get 5 stacks by the time you walk back to the tower. I'm sure most people die to him not knowing that he can 1 hit from 1/2 hp at lvl 6. It's not worth dying for 20gold + you can still be useful by ganking for teammates which can put you ahead
also his lvl 1 sucks if he takes q and you dodge & get hit by the handle

Your wrong. Yasuo is not even an easy champ to play. People say "oh hes broken" i tried him the other day and his combos are complex and intricate. There is nothing broken about him, learn to counter him. Darius counters him fiora, any of them he isn't broken just strong when played well.

How are his combo's intricate? You spam Q until you get a whirlwind, then you press R

and just incase you're a special kind of plebeian who cant hit skillshots.. You can just dash at them and press Q to make the hurricane an aoe ability instead of a skillshot...

I mained Yasuo up from the moment he came out up until the day that Azir came out, and he isn't hard at all.

Yasuo has a high skill ceiling its true, but a very low skill floor.
yep he isn't hard to play at the lowest level like. that just means the opponent is playing at an even worse level by being unable/unbothered to counter such a shit player

He's an AD auto attack champion with bonus crib, no mana and gets a shield for just walking around...

how hard can he really be?...

Answer: I mained him for a while, and he is easy to do well with.

then clearly, no one is cornering you the whole game to make sure you don't do well (even though your playing him horribly by doing nothing other than right clicking)
the hard part about him is working around people who corner you the whole game, make you recall for getting 1 cs though no one does that in bronze or even up to plat so it'd seem to you that yas is an easy champ

no i think you don't understand. most yasuo's arent that goood. his whirlwind isn't that easy to hit and all you have to do is know your champ better than his. Im quite confused as to how you see him as broken because i'd say you need a good 100-200 wins to actually be skilled or good at using him.
glad someone has a sense of logic around here {{summoner:1}}
yea lol. everyone complains about yas but he legitmately is hard to play and is not broken i tried him in one for all and had absolute hell. I gave up early lol i didn't want to put in the time.

I mained Yas from the day he came out till the day Azir came out, i had a high win rate on him, ended the majority of my games with a positive score (often extremely so, cos its yasuo). And would generally win lane by a long way. 
I hardly even play him now, but when i do, i still play better than a lot of Yasuo's that i see around. But just because i love the champion thematically and can play him okay doesn't make me blind to his faults.


So... maybe rethink your argument?

Reasons aren't valid?

If they arent Valid how come Yasuo is THE most complained about champion in the whole game.

If Yasuo is perfectly fine, why aren't people complaining about Ammumu or Jinx or other champions? Why are they always complaining about Yasuo?

Just saying they are invalid doesn't make them so. show me the proof. 

And because all you need to do is count the complaint threads on boards and reddit, and you can see for yourself that Yasuo is the champ that most people are complaining about. All you need to do is look and your see I'm right. 

Yea people complain about Jinx and Ammumu, but no where near as much as Yasuo.

I read the context. 'Had' has no relevance to wether he should be bullied or not.
Therefore i can only assume you meant 'Has'.

Its his lifesteal that i find most bs... 

He 2v1ed me as 5000 HP Yorick with thornmail, and someone else was there too, i cant remember who , (and i had the maiden attacking him) We were full HP, and he was half at the beginning of the fight, he had ONLY mercurial scimitar and the bloodlust mastery for lifestal.

And he killed us both, he didn't even use his dash, he just sat there attacking us and we just could not kill him cos if the lifesteal.
if that's what he's strong at, you simply don't just stand there and let him hit you knowing he'll lifesteal all your damage back [lol is a strategy game!]

Yea cos i _totally_ **expected** him to win a 1v2 at half hp (1v3 if you count the maiden) aye.... 

What else am I supposed to do? We outnumbered him 3 to 1, none of us could match his mobility, my movement speed was less than his obviously and my range significantly less so, so what am i supposed to do? Kite him? as Yorick? No.

Think again. 

Im Yorick, one of the more damaging tanks, with the maiden, and thornmail, he should NOT be able to win as 1v1 let alone 1v3....

"Yea cos i totally *expected* him to win a 1v2 at half hp" - well know you know that you should know your matchups before you go in; and beating you unexpected would count as an outplay

"What else am I supposed to do?" - don't engage in the first place unless your going to chain cc him or something

"what am i supposed to do? Kite him? as Yorick? No." - yea don't do it just run (even better, don't engage in the first place) , he can't chase and kill you with just a mercs;
"none of us could match his mobility," though you clearly said he just sat there attacking so i don't see what this has to do with anything

"Think again." - you too

"Im Yorick, one of the more damaging tanks, with the maiden, and thornmail, he should NOT be able to win as 1v1 let alone 1v3...." - lifesteal is very strong against tanks in addition to yasuo dealing sustained dmg
+ i don't see how you could have possibly outdamaged him 
+ mercs gives mr and half of yoricks abilities do magic dmg & i assume you had no ap
+ if you're just duelling him, you're passive isn't very effective
so basically, you're just trading autos with him and chucking a q every 5 seconds 
+ yasuo scales very well with items & excels in duels as opposed to teamfights. he had items, he had a 1v2, as far as i see, that's already a pretty good advantage for him ( a yas with just a mercs is going to get shit on in a 5v5)


honestly you're probably exaggerating too
(5k hp would be at least 3-4 hp items + thornmail + boots would leave you with 1 item slot for ad + you're dealing hybrid dmg with no penetration) this is assuming you had 6 items against his 1 merc which should not be possible unless the yas was 0/10
- plus he has a shield which you didn't mention
- if what you said was true that he had nothing other than a mercs, you have 5k hp + 2 other people attacking him(maiden doesn't deal much anyway), you weren't taking minion aggro, and he just sat there, move or dash, then i doubt he'd win unless all 3 of you were dealing less than 200dps

http://www.lolcounter.com/tips/yasuo/general?page=1 i'll guarantee you didn't follow half those tips

yasuo is just another easy matchup imo especially since most people i've seen can't play him (including bronze, silver, gold mains)
he's one of those champs you need to delay his late game item power spike as long as possible; low elos don't punish much so it's very easy to play early game farm late game carry champs. early ganks, pop his passive, whack him every time he goes to cs (he can't hit you bc he's hitting the minion),  don't trade with him past lvl 6, aim to group and take objectives before he recovers.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=709lVzOg8c0 arkadata gets counterpicked, beats up the yas bc he knows how to play against one ; there's always someone tailing yas to make sure he doesn't get the farm he needs to make it back into the game

hope this helps :)

Just going to weigh in here, alot of your argument revolved around "you said he only had mercs"

He didnt say that he said "He only had mercs for lifesteal" as in the only lifesteal item he had was mercs.

Tbh if a yas first item'd a mercs its probably gg his teams already lost by that point.

Some reading comprehension wouldve gone a long way here.

Think about what I'm saying man, I was a full HP Yorick with thornmail and the maiden, i was attacking Yasuo, along side someone else on my team. 

It was a 3v1** (A 3V1)** i had every reason to believe that we should win that fight. NO champion in the game should be able to win a 3v1 while on half HP, there was no reason for me to not go in, and no reason for me to run.

So yes i was surprised when he won a fight that he should not have been able to.

Im saying theres no point trying to kite him or run away because his mobility his greater then ours, therefore standing to fight was the only option, you just lose damage by trying to run.

I didnt need to out damage him, it was a 3v1, there was me, the maiden, someone else (who might have been miss fortune, but i cant remember) But Yorick and the maiden by themselves do a shit ton of damage _(no where near the output Yasuo has, but enough to leave a dent in anyone, remember that 1 of York's Q's does around 600/700 damage)_ 

and the maiden does a lot of damage by itself, and not only that but it buffs your attacks too. 


No I'm not exaggerating at all, I was full build, and my non-defensive item was Tri-force. 
I never said Yasuo's only item was mercurial scimitar, i said it was his only_ lifesteal _ item. He was near full build. 
I cant remember if he had his shield or not.
What i do remember is that me, the maiden and 1 other person threw everything we had at Yasuo, and he lifestealed his way through it all. _(if it didn't happen that way, i wouldn't be here writing about it would i)_

If he was near full build with 30% lifesteal, there's no doubt that he's going to win since he scales very strongly with items peaking at lategame. You're not going to beat a yas with just a triforce as damage.

yas has his q on a 1.33 cd which also applies lifesteal and should get off at least 3 before you get 1 q onto him and at least an auto-q before he gets hit once plus he's going to have the extra dmg from ie and 100% crit. 

if that other person was a missfortune then they'd get 1 hit by a yas e-q anyway so it'd be a 2v1. 
maiden makes auto attacks do %hp dmg (yasuo does not stack hp and being on half hp makes it do near nothing)
the attacks won't do much either since you only had a triforce

my point is that
1. he's not uncounterable otherwise every bronze with a working right mouse button would be carrying they're way to diamond (clearly they know how to play against a yas since this hasn't happened) 
2. you don't go into a yasuo with items expecting to win even if it's a 1v5 unless you can 100-0 him or keep him cc'd. you had no cc or burst. i don't see any way you could have won
3. low elo yasuos can't even play him, any champ with dps can just snowball off one of them + an early ninja tabi & chainmail is going to take out a lot of his dmg

also, crit destroys hp, lifesteal is strong against tanks, and 1 thornmail isn't going to do much. a better item would be randuins/frozen heart and you probably didn't think of getting that greivous wound item either
I'd enjoy seeing Yorick kite Yasuo. Good luck with that
